Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON / ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush on off thermostat module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF.

Item.label: ALL ON: Y, ALL OFF: Y
ALL ON: N, ALL OFF: N
ALL ON: N, ALL OFF: Y
ALL ON: Y, ALL OFF: N

Value.label: Input 2 changes setpoint to
Value.Help: When I2 is trigged, setpoint will be set according to the value of this parameter. Default value 32767 - Input 2 does not change setpoint. 0000 - 0990 - Setpoint from +00.0°C to +99.0°C, .1°C step. 1001 - 1150 - Setpoint from -00.1°C to -15.0°C, .1°C step.

Value.label: Input 3 changes setpoint to
Value.Help: When I2 is trigged, setpoint will be set according to the value of this parameter. Default value 32767 - Input 3 does not change setpoint. 0000 - 0990 - Setpoint from +00.0°C to +99.0°C, .1°C step. 1001 - 1150 - Setpoint from -00.1°C to -15.0°C, .1°C step.

Value.label: Save state / restore after power failure

Item.label: Yes
No. Set heater to Off after power failure

Value.label: Power reporting on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 000: Reporting Disabled. 001 - 100 = 1% - 100%: Reporting enabled: power report is sent when actual power changes by more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power. Step is 1%. Default value 003 -> 3%

Value.label: Power reporting by time interval
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 32767 seconds. 00000: Reporting Disabled. 00001 - 32767 = 1 second - 32767 seconds: Reporting enabled: power report is sent each time interval as set. Default value 300 -> power report in Watts is sent every 300s

Value.label: Hysteresis for heater turn-on
Value.Help: Minimal difference between measured temperature and setpoint to turn heating on. Set from 0 to 255. 000 to 127 means from +00.0 °C to +12.7 °C, .1°C step. 128 to 255 means from -00.1 °C to -12.7 °C, .1°C step. Default value 132 (= 128 + 004) -> -00.5 °C (= -00.1 + 00.4)

Value.label: Hysteresis for heater turn-off
Value.Help: Minimal difference between measured temperature and setpoint to turn heating off. Set from 0 to 255. 000 to 127 means from +00.0 °C to +12.7 °C, .1°C step. 128 to 255 means from -00.1 °C to -12.7 °C, .1°C step. Default value 005 -> +00.5 °C

Value.label: Antifreeze
Value.Help: Temperature below which heater turns on even if the thermostat was manually set to off. Set from 0 to 255. 000 to 127 means from +00.0 °C to +12.7 °C, .1°C step. 128 to 255 means from -00.1 °C to -12.7 °C, .1°C step. Default value 050 -> +05.0 °C

Value.label: Low temperature alarm
Value.Help: Low temperature alarm is sent to Group 5 when temperature passes below set value. Set from 0001 to 1000 = 000,1°C to 100,0 °C, .1°C step. Default value 0050 -> +005.0 °C If value is set out of range, the module resets the value to default.

Value.label: High temperature alarm
Value.Help: High temperature alarm is sent to Group 4 when temperature passes below set value. Set from 0001 to 1000 = 000,1°C to 100,0 °C, .1°C step. Default value 0700 -> +070.0 °C If value is set out of range, the module resets the value to default.

Value.label: Module output 'Q' mode selection
Value.Help: Type of heater connected to module output 'Q'. Default value 0 -> When heater off the output is 0 V.

Item.label: When heater off the output is 0 V.
When heater off the output is 230 V.

Value.label: Enable/Disable endpoint I1 or select notification type and event
Value.Help: Enabling I1 means that the Endpoint I1 will be present on the UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a notification type and event can be selected for the endpoint.

Item.label: Endpoint I1 disabled
Home Security; Motion Detection; unknown location
CO; Carbon Monoxide detected; unknown location
CO2; Carbon Dioxide detected; unknown location
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected; unknown location
Heat Alarm; Water Leak detected; unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected; unknown location
Sensor binary

Value.label: Enable/Disable endpoint I2 or select notification type and event
Value.Help: Enabling I2 means that the Endpoint I2 will be present on the UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a notification type and event can be selected for the endpoint.

Item.label: Endpoint I2 disabled
Home Security; Motion Detection; unknown location
CO; Carbon Monoxide detected; unknown location
CO2; Carbon Dioxide detected; unknown location
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected; unknown location
Heat Alarm; Water Leak detected; unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected; unknown location
Sensor binary

Value.label: Enable/Disable endpoint I3 or select notification type and event
Value.Help: Enabling I3 means that the Endpoint I3 will be present on the UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a notification type and event can be selected for the endpoint.

Item.label: Endpoint I3 disabled
Home Security; Motion Detection; unknown location
CO; Carbon Monoxide detected; unknown location
CO2; Carbon Dioxide detected; unknown location
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected; unknown location
Heat Alarm; Water Leak detected; unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected; unknown location
Sensor binary

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset
Value.Help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by the sensor. Default value 32536 -> +0°C 0001 - 0100 = value from +00,1°C to +10,0°C added to measurement 1001 - 1100 = value from -00,1°C to -10,0°C subtracted from measurement

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: When temperature sensor is connected, the module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Default value 005 = 00,5°C. 000 - Reporting disabled 001 - 127 = 00,1°C - 12,7°C, step .1°C

Group.label: Basic Set triggered at the change of output Q and reflecting it's state.
Basic Set triggered at the change of thermostat mode.
Basic Set triggered by High temperature alarm.
Basic Set triggered by Low temperature alarm.
Basic Set triggered by change of input I1.
Basic Set triggered by change of input I2.
Basic Set triggered by change of input I3.
Basic Set triggered by change of temperature.
